content: Hello, I'm wondering if anyone has a Bulk Data Server out on the web that can be used for testing. I see there is a list here: https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/fhir-bulk-data-docs/blob/master/implementations.md but it looks like some of the links may be out of date. Also, I'm hoping to test without OAuth or other security (beyond https that is) so I can just focus on the Bulk Data exchange mechanics itself for now. Thanks!
The SMART reference server also supports testing without OAuth
And @Jenni Syed may be able to comment on the status of the Cerner test server
And @Isaac Vetter may be able to comment on the status of the Epic test server
(Please share updates to the implementations.md page if details have changed.)
Hey All, we need to deploy some code to bring the Epic test server up-to-date. I'll update this thread when that happens before the Sept connectathon.
@Grahame Grieve do I need to use a particular Group ID?

@Josh Mandel For the SMART reference server, what's the actual URL I need to hit? Is https://bulk-data.smarthealthit.org/ the base URL? Sorry I'm a little confused by the page I see when I browse there because it talks about launching and OAuth stuff.
@Josh Mandel Ah, I tried hitting the "FHIR Server URL" on the bottom of the page and it seems to work. Thanks!
you define your own group on my server
@Grahame Grieve does that mean I can use whatever group ID I want or do I have to send a Create request in for a Group?
server allows you to put to any id, or or you can post.
